thread.title: Watch: 'Hamilton' singers add 'sisterhood' during 'America the Beautiful' Super Bowl performance
thread.title_full: Watch: 'Hamilton' singers add 'sisterhood' during 'America the Beautiful' Super Bowl performance | Washington Examiner

author: Anna Giaritelli
title: Watch: 'Hamilton' singers add 'sisterhood' during 'America the Beautiful' Super Bowl performance
text:
The first political message of the Super Bowl came when three of the original Broadway stars from "Hamilton" added the word "sisterhood" during their singing of "America the Beautiful" Sunday night.
Renee Elise Goldsberry, Jasmine Cephas Jones and Phillipa Soo added "sisterhood" after the traditional mention of "brotherhood."
"America! America! God shed his grace on thee. And crown thy good with brotherhood — and sisterhood," the women sang, "From sea to shining sea."
"Hamilton" creator Lin-Manuel Miranda praised the performers' addition of "sisterhood," tweeting a photo of the trio along with the caption, "AND SISTERHOOD."
Stay abreast of the latest developments from nation's capital and beyond with curated News Alerts from the Washington Examiner news desk and delivered to your inbox.
  Washington Examiner News Alerts.   alert soon! AND SISTERHOOD. pic.twitter.com/2Zx8Sg9XmW — Lin-Manuel Miranda (@Lin_Manuel) February 5, 2017
